title: Two-factor authentication bypass lead to information disclosure about the program and all hackers participate
content:
Summary:
Two-factor authentication bypass lead to information disclosure about the program and all hackers participate
Description:

steps: Turn on two-factor authentication using a Google app without an account
Access and accept an invitation to a private program to view its details and participants
Turn on two-factor authentication again, this time connecting it with your email from the Google app
Notice that you receive the same invitations again via email
Accept the invitations again to view the same program data
vuln_description: A two-factor authentication bypass allows unauthorized access to private program details and participant information by manipulating the authentication setup process. By initially setting up two-factor authentication without an account, a user can accept invitations and view sensitive data. Disabling and re-enabling two-factor authentication with an email account then triggers the system to re-send invitations, allowing the user to access the same data again.
reason: The vulnerability involves a non-obvious interaction between the two-factor authentication setup process and the invitation system. The attacker must understand that setting up two-factor authentication without an account allows bypassing the intended security checks, and that reconfiguring it with an email account resets the invitation state. This requires knowledge of both the authentication flow and the invitation handling logic.
